results.title: Rip-offs
results.creator_credit: Alex Stiff and Victoria. Ministry of Consumer Affairs
results.brief_description: Animation in the style of “Life Be in it”, outlining money making scams the consumer should be aware of. Uses real life stries to illustrate these pitfalls with cartoon characters ‘Oscar Wilde’ and ‘Samuel Johnson’.

results.title: Riot
results.brief_description: A look at the 1970s Gay Rights Movement in Australia through the eyes of dedicated activist Lance Gowland. As Lance deals with his sexuality, he must also juggle work, family and relationships.

constellations_other.name: Fight for your right
constellations_other.description: Real world revolution and the fictional representations that reflect the struggle for equality in the past, present and dystopian future.

results.title: Rio Rita
results.creator_credit: S. Sylvan Simon, Pandro S. Berman and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A slapstick comedy of espionage, German spies and two unlikely heroes, Doc and Wishy, played by Bud Abbott and Lou Costello. Cast also includes Kathryn Grayson, John Carroll, Tom Conway.

results.title: Rio Negro = Black River
results.creator_credit: Manuel Perez, Santiago Llapur and ICAIC
results.brief_description: The drama begins on the morning of 17 April 1961, as news of the Bay of Pigs invasion reaches the Black River area of the Escambray Mountains in central Cuba. Tirso Fabre, a militiaman and member of the Black River co-operative farm, and Chano Carrillo, a counterrevolutionary hiding behind his front as a Castro sympathizer, receive the news in different ways, in line with their antagonistic ideological positions. The film traces a long-running personal feud between the two men of which the roots go back to the pre-revolutionary years, in a story told in flashback and flashforward. Cast includes Sergio Corrieri and Nelson Villagra. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Rio Lobo (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks, Howard Hawks Productions and Malabar Productions
results.brief_description: John Wayne portrays a former Union officer searching for a traitor in this post-Civil War action drama directed by Howard Hawks. The war is over, but Col. Cord McNally (Wayne) is still hunting the informer who caused the death of a young officer. His quest brings him to the town of Rio Lobo, where he joins forces with two ex-rebels, helps save this small piece of Texas from ruthless outlaws, and finally comes face to face with his quarry. Featuring Jennifer O’Neil, Chris Mitcham and Jack Elam, this film brings together the talents of two Western legends.

results.title: Rio Grande
results.creator_credit: John Ford, Merian C. Cooper and Republic Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: John Wayne is Lieutenant Colonel Kirby Yorke, a member of the US Cavalry defending the Rio Grande from attacking Apache Indians. His son Jeff, who he hasn’t seen for fifteen years, joins the unit and very soon after Yorke’s estranged wife (Maureen O’Hara) arrives to demand their son return home. Having lost his wife’s respect over his actions in the Civil War, Jeff’s arrival offers Yorke the opportunity to prove himself again to his wife. Their rekindled romance, however, is put at risk when a tribe of Apaches attack the lonely outpost community. Directed by veteran John Ford, this is a classically structured western film that features an outstanding group of character actors including Ben Johnson and Victor McGlaglen. If the depiction of the Native Americans may turn contemporary stomachs, the final action scenes are inarguably rousing and deftly executed.

results.title: Rio Bravo(Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks, Armada Productions and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Sheriff John T. Chance arrests a gunslinger for a brutal murder. However, the outlaw’s brother is the most powerful rancher on the border and his desperadoes surround Rio Bravo so that Chance can’t get his prisoner out and the U.S. Marshall can’t get in. Hired gunmen slip silently into the little town, waiting for a chance to strike. This classic western combines the talents of John Wayne and Dean Martin with the much acclaimed skill of Howard Hawks.

results.title: Ring of bright water
results.creator_credit: Jack Couffer, Joseph Strick and Palomar Pictures
results.brief_description: Graham Merril (Bill Travers), a discontented civil servant and his pet otter flee London and head to the western Highlands when they realise city life is not for either of them. He seeks the assistance of local doctor, Mary Mackenzie (Virginia McKenna), to help him and his family of otters.
